result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard Lee Jeffers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court for Howard Lee Jeffers. Student Intern Bailey Groh Rasmussen under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case is adjourned to Branch 29 for sentencing.

Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court for Howard Lee Jeffers.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. Defense counsel advises the Court this case is now in a resolution posture. Court passes case for defense counsel to fill out plea paperwork.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by video for Howard Lee Jeffers.  Prosecuting attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 9/12/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by video for Howard Lee Jeffers.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. No objections from the State. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
of expert testimony and use of DNA, filed.

Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court, defendant Howard Lee Jeffers not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Defendant not produced. Discovery issues put forth on the record. Parties further requests an adjourned Final Pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Received and Filed. Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST

Attorney Zak Wroblewski for Jason Daniel Baltz in court, defendant Howard Lee Jeffers not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers in court, appear by video with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz, appear by video.  Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Alexander.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 051708,
Payable Number: 1010636,
Receipt Number: 22RP022382,
Amount: $20.00
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MAJ.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Defendant Howard Lee Jeffers in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Howard Lee Jeffers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
